alert.note: Alert for East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southeast Tularosa Basin; West Central Tularosa Basin, White Sands; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 30 at 4:37AM MDT until September 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: .Moist, southerly flow will strengthen over eastern portions of the Borderland on today in between a ridge to the east and a strong upper trough to the west. Scattered to widespread showers and thunderstorms will develop this afternoon and evening, lasting into the overnight hours. Conditions improve by Sunday morning. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico, including the following areas, Otero County and far eastern Dona Ana and far eastern Sierra Counties. Portions of southwest Texas, including the following areas, El Paso and Hudspeth Counties. * WHEN...From noon MDT today through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of arroyos, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
